grading_system.description: Could not verify specific grading system used by Inyo County. California counties may use letter grades (A/B/C), numerical scores, or pass/fail systems, but Inyo County's specific system was not found in official sources.

inspection_details.frequency: Regular inspections conducted by Registered Environmental Health Specialists - specific frequency not verified
inspection_details.public_disclosure: Inspection reports must be made available upon request per California Retail Food Code

facility_safety_authority.department_name: Local fire departments - specific AHJ not identified
facility_safety_authority.ansul_system_requirements: Semi-annual inspections required per California Fire Code and NFPA 96 standards
facility_safety_authority.inspection_frequency: Every 6 months for commercial kitchen fire suppression systems

regulatory_framework.food_code_basis: California Retail Food Code (CalCode) - California Health and Safety Code
regulatory_framework.state_vs_local_authority: County-level inspections conducted by Inyo County Environmental Health Department
regulatory_framework.local_ordinances: County fee schedule and permitting requirements per Municipal Code Chapter 7.52

confidence_notes: While I confirmed Inyo County Environmental Health Department exists and conducts food facility inspections using California Retail Food Code, I could not verify their specific grading/scoring system from official county sources. Earlier search results showing letter grades were from Imperial County, not Inyo County.
verification_notes: Direct contact with Inyo County Environmental Health Department (760-878-0238) is recommended to verify: (1) specific grading system used (letter grades, numerical scores, or pass/fail), (2) inspection frequency and risk-based scheduling, (3) grade thresholds if applicable, (4) public posting requirements, and (5) local fire department inspection authority for commercial kitchen systems.
